comments.body: Can you please change the license_family to PUBLIC-DOMAIN? Otherwise, the recipe looks good to me.
@npavlovikj No I can't. The license of the package is  not a Public domain hence it doesn't belong to PUBLIC-DOMAIN family. That would be a lie.
@npavlovikj Is there an umbrella license family for FOSS licenses (free and open source)? I searched for one but didn't found. If there is one like that then I would gladly switch.

Ah, thanks for clarifying that - I missed the "Aggregate" part.

Since there are multiple licenses, can you please try adding them in a list:
`license: Apache-2.0 AND SIL OFL 1.1 AND Public Domain AND DejaVu Fonts `
This is an example PR, https://github.com/conda-forge/staged-recipes/pull/10329/files.

Leaving the family type to OTHER is fine in this case, looks like FOSS fails under that, https://github.com/conda/conda-build/blob/7dac1cbad5195f719bde1eaeb0d5795186dc0eb0/tests/test_license_family.py#L130.

@npavlovikj I've fixed this recipe and it's now MIT. Please review and merge.

Actually this (py-open-fonts) conda package only contains MIT licensed code. Complex fonts licenses are already packaged in open-fonts conda package. I consider changing it's recipe but I'm not sure. Please see this issue: https://github.com/conda-forge/open-fonts-feedstock/issues/1

@npavlovikj Nevermind open-fonts conda package license issue: I've already fixed it thanks to your suggestion.

Please review this py-open-fonts recipe that is now MIT only (as it only contains MIT source code).

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +39,43 @@  home: https://github.com/kiwi0fruit/py-open-fonts
  license: MIT AND Apache-2.0 AND SIL-OFL-1.1 AND Public-Domain AND DejaVu-Fonts
  license_family: OTHER
  license_file: LICENSE
  summary: "CLI and Python interface to the open-fonts conda package that is agnostic to the fonts there."
